title: Layer of Eat and Drink in LA
name: Layer of Eat and Drink in LA

properties.name: Asian Noodles
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape643 N Spring St, Los Angeles, CALittle Filipino restaurant in Chinatown that isn\'t a buffet. For anyone who\'s eaten filipino food outside of someone\'s home, these "nicer" restaurants are rare unless you live in New York. The service is atypical for Asians (they\'re really not all that friendly), but not really cold. If you don\'t come in expecting your mom\'s style of filipino food, then you\'ll realize the food is pretty good. As with all filipino food, this probably isn\'t the best place to come if you\'re on a diet - but if you do eat and feel good, then go to the gym tomorrow. 90044

properties.name: Bar 107
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape107 W 4th Street, Los Angeles, CADirty little dive bar with lots of personality in the bank district of downtown LA. Beer selection is typical dive bar beer, but a good place to go and have a quick drink when it\'s nasty hot outside and you want to escape the heat with people who don\'t give a shit about you either.

properties.name: Blossom
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape426 S. Main St, Los Angeles, CACasual local Vietnamese restaurant in the bank district of downtown LA. $ - menu is online. Pho is decent (compared to pho houses in Alhambra and Monterey Park) but rice dishes are better with a strong lemongrass taste.

properties.name: Canters
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape419 N. Fairfax Ave, Los Angeles, CA$ Is this considered an institution? Probably. 24-hour restaurant - diner/ cafeteria style with a deli, bakery, kibitz room bar, and old school favorites.

properties.name: Cassell
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape3266 W. 6th St, Los Angeles, CA$ Old cafeteria style burger joint in Koreatown. They give you the meat on the bun with cheese or bacon if you want and you add the toppings. Arguably one the best burger places in Los Angeles.

properties.name: Frances
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape404 E. 2nd Street, Los Angeles, CACakes and pastries in Little Tokyo. Cute little pastry shop in Little Tokyo selling chocolate, cakes, and other pastries. Everything I\'ve had here has been delicious.

properties.name: Groundwork Coffee Company
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape 108 W. 2nd Street, Los Angeles, CACoffee house located on the ground floor of the Higgins Building in downtown LA. There are two locations in downtown LA and other locations all over LA. Coffee and tea is served and it\'s a great alternative for anyone sick of starbucks. They boast "100% certified organics, fairly traded, shade grown, single origin and custom blended coffees". Even if you could give a !!! about organic products, the coffee is good stuff. Try it and feel good.

properties.name: Indochine Vien
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape3110 Glendale Blvd, Los Angeles, CASmall little restaurant, modern, asian-ish decor. Vietnamese food with vegetarian selections for those non-carnivores. Rice dishes are tasty and the pho is just okay. Service is dependent on the number of people at the restaurant. 90043

properties.name: Komasa
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape351 E. 2nd St., Los Angeles, CATiny little sushi restaurant in little tokyo. Service is attentive and extremely polite considering how many people are waiting for a table. Sushi is very reasonably priced and as many times as we\'ve been there, consistently fresh. If you\'re not quite there yet with raw fish - they also have cooked dishes there.

properties.name: Kuishimbo
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape3407 W. 6th St 101-A, Los Angeles, CAJapanese charbroiled seafood, beef, & chicken. Small little place with indoor and outdoor seating in Koreatown. Quick service for flavorful and good sized portions of meat, salad, and side of rice. $

properties.name: Library Bar
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape630 W. 6th Street, Los Angeles, CABar located across the street from the Los Angeles Library. A nice looking bar with a literary theme and an excellent beer selection (belgiums and microbrews). Crowd is a more professional late 20\'s/30\'s one - borderline meat market feel on the weekends. During the week, it\'s an after work crowd, more mellow, less meat market.

properties.name: Loose Leaf
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape630 W. 6th Street #110B, Los Angeles, CASeems like a bad idea to only deal in salads, but this is California and healthy sells. Salads are a good portion for the (with the toppings) they charge and the toppings are really varied. You choose a meat - ahi tuna, steak, chicken, etc..., the base lettuce, and various toppings - corn, garbanzo beans, green onions, avocado, various cheeses, etc. You get the picture. What you get in the end is enough to satisfy your hunger and not feel guilty about the calories you just wolfed down.

properties.name: Orochon Ramen
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape123 S. Onizuka St #303, Los Angeles, CASmall restaurant serving up Japanese ramen spiced up to your liking. You have a choice of three different base soups and can add additional ingredients to your broth. I believe that seven is the mildest and it goes down to 1 (very spicy) and an additional 2 levels of hellish heat. If you want your picture on the wall, you need to finish the hottest spice level in 30 minutes.

properties.name: Palms Thai Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape 5900 Hollywood Blvd, Los Angeles, CABig room with family style seating. Outdoor seating too. Prices are 90039 and portions are not small, but not cheesecake factory big. Service is friendly but not overbearing. Food is decent. BBQ beef is flavorful and not overcooked. Baby Corn chicken is a little bland, smoothies are overly sweet. Three and a half stars. Guessing that most of the dishes are pretty decent.

properties.name: Pho Viet
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape209 S. Vermont Ave, Los Angeles, CAIn a dirty little strip mall with shops primarily serving the nearby asian community. Pho restaurant serving both rice plates and pho. The pho here is pretty good and the rice plates are okay. Solid cheap food.

properties.name: Royal Claytons
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape1855 Industrial St, Los Angeles, CANice looking restaurant/bar with live music (think blues or jazz) and friendly bartenders. 90048

properties.name: Smog Cutter
properties.description: Posted by Ducttape 865 N. Virgil Ave, Los Angeles, CASmall little karaoke bar with a pool table, office chairs, pictures of actors and actresses, phone books, and feisty Thai bartenders/ servers/ owners?? Drink selection is pretty typical for a little bar like this, but the atmosphere is something to remember. Because of this bar we are now the sweet love couple number 1!
